column4: my sound had departed the building tonight after working flawlessly for nearly a month I have rebooted and checked everything I can think of with no luck
does anyone have a suggestion on how to fix my sound please
try:  killall pulseaudio; rm -r ~/.pulse*
okay but what happens after I remove pulseaudio
pulseaudio isn't removed, the process is merely killed, it will restart after a few seconds
okay I'll try it
Thankyou so much that worked perfectly
np :), you just gave the sound default settings. helps a lot
I've saved it too an evernote note so it's ready if I ever need it again
could make it a script :)
to run at startup you mean?
no, just to run when needed
or make an alias instead
I guess I could
I'm better with aliases
see if you need it again, might not be required
unity uses Gnome3 as it;s DE if you are using Oneiric
Unity isn't a DE
okay I didn't know that so is it possible to get vanilla gnome 3 sans unity?
there is a method to make it look like Gnome2 if you wish
http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2011/12/how-to-make-ubuntu-11-10-look-and-feel-like-gnome-2/
thanks I'll check it out
